reviews.text: The BIG NEGATIVE: I contacted the hotel before arrival and asked for a quiet room - we were allocated I believe the quietest room they have at the top / back of the property. Our stay was on a Sunday night so I hoped not party night. The hotel does not have air conditioning so you must have the windows open if you aren't going to expire with heat. The noise from the bar "The Tube" is intolerable way into the early hours combined with street noise from this busy part of town / aircraft taking off and flying over from about 6am etc etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This boutique hotel is a little pearl in the heart of Old Luxembourg. An old house that has been converted, it has about 10 rooms (all suites with a separate living room, actually), almost all very different from one another. The decor is classy: predominantly white, modern and sober, yet it feels very cozy, in part because of the warm lighting and the soft wooden plank flooring. Pristine, modern, Grohe-equipped bathrooms (showers in most rooms), with robes and slippers. Breakfast, which was complimentary in my case, is excellent and as much (including cheese, hams, and eggs) or as little as you like. There are a few other "Goeres" hotels in Luxembourg, but this one is named "Beaux-Arts" because of the big art pieces that adorn each suite and make it unique. The staff is extremely kind and welcoming, making you feel at home. Other than the fact that the front part of the building can be somewhat noisy at night, as noted by other reviewers (and I do confirm this), the only other little glitches for a hotel of that class is that there is no safe deposit box inside the room, and that the single flat-screen TV set sits in the living room of the suites, so you cannot watch TV from bed (at least in the rooms I saw). However, none of these little flaws was enough of a nuisance in my judgment to warrant a downgrade from five stars rating. All in all, a wonderful find, which I can only recommend highly and where I will certainly return.
reviews.title: Great location, big room

reviews.text: This was a great hotel in the heart of Luxembourg. Our room was more like a suite, spacious and comfortable. An art museum is right next door, the palace and main square are a block away, and great shopping and restaurants are all around. Staff was helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great hotel to stay in, stayed for 2 nights. The room was huge, more like a suite than a room really. They even included a laptop with free internet use which was very handy for looking up things to do, nearby restaurants etc. Staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. Interesting artwork on the walls too. Very central which was a blessing and a curse, bit loud at night, although we may have contributed too the noise one or two of the nights coming back from the pub! Overall great experience would definitely stay again and recommend the place to anyone looking for a hotel in Luxembourg!
reviews.title: Incredible hotel in the perfect location

reviews.text: Extremely unassuming outside, charming, historical inside. Art decor, upscale decor - even a Villeroy & Boch bathroom sink! Booked a room for 3 people and were given the equivalent of a 1-bedroom apartment/flat with an extra bed placed in the living room/seating area with the TV. Perfect location and a very warm welcome from Alan (or Alain) upon arrival. Would definitely book again.
reviews.title: Unesco heritage site!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Parc Beaux-Arts is a perfect base for exploring Luxembourg City. The suites are large and tastefully decorated, and the included breakfast is delicious. Many restaurants and sites are within a short walk of the hotel. Several others commented about the noise -- yes, it can be a little bit noisy because the hotel is across the street from several dining and entertainment venues. Despite the noise, however, a stay at the Parc Beaux Arts is well worth the price.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Charming, Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed here in early December 2012 for a weekend birthday getaway. It was a cold snowy weekend, perfect for getting into the holiday spirit. The room was warm and inviting with a bed in the upper loft. Gorgeous pillows, firm big bed with proper down duvet. Not loads of room but great for a few days.
